title: 100Danish
description: Ecommerce website offering natural body care products.
descriptionSingle:
Bathtime 
 is a ecommerce based on Prestashop platform, selling natural and cruelty free products for body care.  I follow the entir project, from customer communications to environments setting up (production, stage and local), to actual functionality development. 
 I coordinate another developer for the design and templating side. To collaborate and share our code, i set up a git hooks system in order to automatically add our code and database changes to the repo everytime we push or pull.
 Most intensive part of this project was the connection with payment system, delivery system and Amazon. THese connection required me a lot of reserach and testing.

title: Boatify
description: Platform aimed to offer boat experiences.
descriptionSingle:
Boatify 
 is a young startup which aim to offer boat rental for baot experience, daily trip or overnight adventure.  At the beginning of Boatify adventure, i wroked as solo Frontend Developer, in collaboration with a Backend Developer. The platform was made in php, Rest API, plain javascript/jquery and sass. I took care about everything Frontend related, from templating to animation and calculation until validation and responsivness. 
 Work at boatify was always under timing pressure and was interesting to find the way to have the best code and architectural result with few time and higest modification-request margin. 
 Very challenging was the development of the booking schedule calendar, done on top of Fullcalendar plugin.

title: Thueringen a la kart
descriptionSingle:
Thueringen a la kart 
 As integration of the Thueringen website, the interactive map allow users to discover which interesting point is present in the region.  The map is based on OpenStreet Map and Leaflet API with custom menu filter and marker aggregator. The menu is also completely responsive. 
 Behind this map there is big research work into Leaflet API. Filter is completely custom and it was interesting to combine it with the Leafletjs. 
 Additionaly, the map is part of CMS, Alchemy CMS; basic familiarity with this tool was also part of the work.

title: BuzzFeed
description: Frontend Developer for renomate news and entertainment platform
descriptionSingle:
BuzzFeed 
 I worked with Buzzfeed as memeber of SASS & Frontend Architectural Refactor Team.  We worked hard to refactor the platform from legacy code to organised Css Architecture. We worked with BEM technique. 
 There i also ha dthe chance to experiment many new technique and find best practice always taking care about old browsers support. 
 My work at BuzzFeed was entirly remote and good communications skills were key part for the success of our team.

title: Extra Paddle
description: Platform with social network functionality developed with Backbone connected to Ruby on Rails backend
descriptionSingle: I followed this project at its early stage. Starting from the UX and user focus reserach, I developed a the workflow with wireframes, then I designed them in a Photoshop mockups. When the mockups were ready I start to work on the user interface developing the single page app with Backbone.js and the static website with jQuery, Html5 and sass.

title: ARTRANK
description: Platform for rating artists and various art category made in Ember.js
descriptionSingle:
Project made during hackership program, a program promote from OpenTechSchool where developers stay full-time in a distraction-free learning environment together with other peers for learn more about a certain topic.
I decided to improve my Javascript skills and learn two javascript framework: Ember and Backbone.
This project is a platform following the wiki idea where the community add information everytime about certains artists and than vote for the various categories in order to have the best and the worst of each category, made by users.

title: CHAT APP
descriptionSingle:
Project made during an hackaton in a team with Rubil on Rails developer and a designer.
BookBeat is an app connected with Readmill API, the user is drive through the process to find the right track for a book choosen from him/her.

description: App with API, Ruby on Rails and Javascript
descriptionSingle:

title: Drag&Drop Html5
descriptionSingle:
Online vinilys shopping developed for Mozilla Contest.
The drag and drop functionality is all develop in Html5

title: Signin with Validation
descriptionSingle:
Sign in form with validation client-side.
In the project there is a particular attention to the UI/UX. The user can see his/her password and have different and appropriate error message for each field.
Developed in Javascript/Jquery making an Ajax request.
